intro: Tetrapeltis, commonly known as the four-leaf clover plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia and is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Tetrapeltis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent.
